definition: to acknowledge allegiance to (some regime)/to serve
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: Surrender to shine with this shimmering coral-pink.
sentences.chinese: 我願臣服在妳的珠光珊瑚色裙襬下。

sentences.english: We guide humans to surrender to the change.
sentences.chinese: 我們引導人類臣服於改變。

sentences.english: Success is also attained by those who surrender to god.
sentences.chinese: 那些臣服於神的人也能夠達到成功。

sentences.english: Round many western islands have I been Which bards in fealty to Apollo hold.
sentences.chinese: 還有多少西方的海島，歌都已使它們向阿波羅臣服。

sentences.english: I let go and surrender to greater peace of mind.
sentences.chinese: 我臣服於內心更多的寧靜。

sentences.english: In the land of pharoahs and kings, they said Egypt could never be humbled.
sentences.chinese: 在法老和國王的土地上，他們說埃及永遠不會臣服。

sentences.english: A token of Sparta's submission to the will of Xerxes.
sentences.chinese: 作爲斯巴達臣服雨薛西斯意志的象徵。

sentences.english: The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it.
sentences.chinese: 擺脫誘惑的唯一方法就是臣服於它。

sentences.english: In this workshop we surrender to rhythm, letting go of what is holding us back.
sentences.chinese: 在這個工作坊裏，我們放下所有包袱，向韻律臣服。

sentences.english: Two years later, in deference to China, he agreed to rein in such sales.
sentences.chinese: 兩年後，他卻臣服於中國，同意逐步減少對臺軍售。

sentences.english: It’s difficult to imagine another industry so thoroughly subservient to one player.
sentences.chinese: 難以想像其他行業裏存在如此徹底臣服於一家的現象。

sentences.english: It looks like you're trying to surrender to the divine but that won't help.
sentences.chinese: 看起來你是在嘗試向神臣服，但這樣是不會有幫助的。

sentences.english: Upon him the Tiger purred, and his hand held manna to scatter.
sentences.chinese: 老虎遇到他都會臣服，而比利手持甘露四處撒播。

sentences.english: Cornell's troops turned Dartmouth's militia into a vassal force.
sentences.chinese: 康奈爾大軍臣服了達特茅斯國民軍。

sentences.english: Vietnam has been fending off Chinese attempts to bring them to heel for over a thousand years.
sentences.chinese: 上千年來，越南人一直在抵擋中國使其臣服的努力。

definition: to surrender and pay allegiance to
to be completely convinced/to fully accept another person's views
to realign one's allegiance (to another religion, ruler etc)/to submit
to vow loyalty and devotion to
to overawe/to be scared into submission
to surrender/to succumb/to yield/(as a transitive verb) to defeat/to prevail over
